author: Rajulapudi Srinivas
text:
For the first time, the number of spot-billed pelicans crossed 5,000 this year in the Kolleru lake of Krishna district in Andhra Pradesh.- PHOTO: V. RAJU

Atapaka Bird Sanctuary, located in Kolleru Lake on the borders of Krishna and West Godavari districts, has been identified as the largest spot-billed pelican home in the world. Environments and bird watchers who visited the sanctuary said Atapaka has the highest number of spot-billed pelicans, also known as grey headed pelicans.

According to the Forest Department, about 5,200 spot-billed pelicans were counted at Atapaka, about 1,000 similar species of birds were spotted at Madhavapuram sanctuary, located in West Godavari district.

Besides, there are about 1,000 pelicans nest in the island villages in Kolleru and the surrounding habitations, they said.

“Every year, we see about 2,000 to 3,000 spot-billed pelicans in the pond, also known as birds’ paradise. For the first time, the number of the winged visitors has crossed 5,000 this year. In addition to the adult birds, many young ones were seen in the nests,” says Divisional Forest Officer (DFO-Wildlife) P. Shivashankar Reddy.

Conservation Biologist in United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) and Scientist Santhi Selvam said, as per the Asian Water Bird Census, about 22,000 grey headed pelicans are spread across the globe, of which about 35 to 40 per cent were roosting at Atakapa Bird Sanctuary.
title: Atapaka in Kolleru, largest home of spot-billed pelican
